Summary: Epic 1: Search and Filtering System
User Story 1.1: As a shopper, I have to be able to search for shoes by keyword in order to quickly find products that match my interests.
User Story 1.2: As a shopper, I have to be able to filter products by category in order to browse shoes in a specific category like MEN or WOMEN.
User Story 1.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to sort products by price in order to find affordable or premium shoes.
User Story 1.4: As a shopper, I have to be able to apply advanced filters like brand and price range in order to narrow down my search more precisely.
User Story 1.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to paginate search results in order to navigate large product lists easily.
User Story 1.6: As a shopper, I want to clear my search query and applied filters so that I can start a new search easily.
User Story 1.7: As a shopper, I want to see feedback about my search query so that I know what I’m searching for and can adjust if needed.
User Story 1.8: As a shopper, I want my search results to be cached locally so that navigating back to the search page is faster.
User Story 1.9: As a shopper, I want to see a friendly error message if the search fails so that I’m not confused by a blank page.
User Story 1.10: As a shopper, I want to see suggested keywords while typing my search query so that I can find products more easily.
Epic 2: Product Listing and Details
User Story 2.1: As a shopper, I have to be able to view products grouped by category in order to explore shoes in MEN, WOMEN, SOCKS, or SALE sections.
User Story 2.2: As a shopper, I have to be able to see a highlighted product in order to find it easily after coming from search.
User Story 2.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to view product details in order to decide if I want to buy it.
User Story 2.4: As a shopper, I have to be able to see if a product is out of stock in order to know if I can buy it.
User Story 2.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to add a product to my cart from the details page in order to buy it later.
User Story 2.6: As a shopper, I have to be able to see the category on product cards in order to know which section the product belongs to.
User Story 2.7: As a shopper, I have to be able to see product images in order to know what the product looks like.
User Story 2.8: As a shopper, I have to be able to go back to the product listing in order to keep browsing after viewing details.
User Story 2.9: As a shopper, I have to be able to see the product price clearly in order to know how much it costs.
User Story 2.10: As a shopper, I have to be able to see a message if no products are found in a category in order to know there are no items.
Epic 3:Cart and Session Management
User Story 3.1: As a shopper, I have to be able to add products to my cart in order to buy them later.
User Story 3.2: As a registered user, I have to be able to see my login status in order to know if I’m signed in.
User Story 3.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to log in or sign up in order to use my account.
User Story 3.4: As a shopper, I have to be able to view my cart in order to check items before buying.
User Story 3.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to remove items from my cart in order to fix my order.
User Story 3.6: As a shopper, I have to be able to change item quantity in my cart in order to buy the right amount.
User Story 3.7: As a shopper, I have to be able to see the total price of my cart in order to know how much I’ll pay.
User Story 3.8: As a shopper, I have to be able to log in before checkout in order to buy my items.
User Story 3.9: As a shopper, I have to be able to see an error if my login fails in order to fix my details.
User Story 3.10: As a registered user, I have to be able to log out in order to keep my account safe.
Epic 4: User Interface and Animations
User Story 4.1: As a shopper, I have to be able to see a loading animation in order to know the page is working
User Story 4.2: As a shopper, I want to see a loading animation, So that I know the page is working.
User Story 4.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to see a hover effect on cards in order to know I can click them.
User Story 4.4: As a shopper, I want to use pages on my tablet, So that I can shop easily.
User Story 4.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to see a hover effect on buttons in order to know they work.
User Story 4.6: As a shopper, I want to see smooth page changes, So that I enjoy using the site.
User Story 4.7: As a shopper, I have to be able to use pages on my computer in order to shop easily.
User Story 4.9: As a shopper, I have to be able to read text easily in order to use the site.
User Story 4.8: As a shopper, I want to see an animation when the cart updates, So that I know it worked.
User Story 4.10: As a shopper, I want to see a hover effect on links, So that I know they work.
Epic 5: Backend and Database Integration
User Story 5.1: As a shopper, I have to be able to see product categories in order to choose what to browse.
User Story 5.2: As a shopper, I want to be able to see a list of products, So that I can find what I want.
User Story 5.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to see product details in order to learn about items.
User Story 5.4: As a shopper, I want to be able to sign up, So that I can create an account.
User Story 5.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to log in in order to access my account.
User Story 5.6: As a registered user, I want to be able to check my session, So that I can stay logged in.
User Story 5.7:  As a admin, I have to be able to update product info in order to keep data current.
User Story 5.8: As a shopper, I want to be able to save my cart, So that I can keep my items.
User Story 5.9: As a shopper, I have to be able to see errors if APIs fail in order to know what went wrong.
User Story 5.10: As an admin, I want to be able to backup the database, So that I can keep data safe.
Epic 6: Deployment and Infrastructure
User Story 6.1: As a developer, I have to be able to deploy the frontend on Vercel in order to make the site live.
User Story 6.3: As a developer, I have to be able to connect the database on PlanetScale in order to store data.
User Story 6.5: As a developer, I have to be able to test the frontend on Vercel in order to make sure it works.
User Story 6.7: As a developer, I have to be able to set up auto-deployment in order to save time on updates.
User Story 6.9: As a developer, I have to be able to make database queries fast in order to load data quickly.
User Story 6.2: As a developer, I have to be able to deploy the backend on Render in order to run APIs.
User Story 6.4: As a developer, I have to be able to set up environment variables in order to keep secrets safe.
User Story 6.6: As a developer, I have to be able to test the backend on Render in order to make sure APIs work.
User Story 6.8: As a developer, I have to be able to monitor site uptime in order to keep the site running.
User Story 6.10: As a developer, I have to be able to roll back a deployment in order to fix issues fast.
Epic 7: Checkout and Order Management
User Story 7.1:  As a shopper, I have to be able to start checkout in order to buy my items.
User Story 7.2: As a shopper, I have to be able to add shipping details in order to get my items.
User Story 7.3: As a shopper, I have to be able to see my order summary in order to check before paying.
User Story 7.4: As a shopper, I have to be able to save my order in order to complete my purchase.
User Story 7.5: As a shopper, I have to be able to clear my cart after ordering in order to start fresh.
User Story 7.6: As a shopper, I have to be able to see order confirmation in order to know my order worked.
User Story 7.7: As a shopper, I have to be able to check stock before ordering in order to avoid issues.
User Story 7.8: As a admin, I have to be able to update stock after an order in order to keep data correct.
User Story 7.9: As a shopper, I have to be able to see my past orders in order to track my purchases.
User Story 7.10: As a shopper, I have to be able to see errors during checkout in order to fix problems.
